channel.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
channel.description:
Hey guys, some of you may be wondering why I am only posting low poly and/or very simply models lately, the reason why is that I am working on some big projects (models) at the time, and I could show you some progress and the beginning as a WIP topic, but I'd rather spend all my time on them to show you how much I really have in myself as a modeller.
On-Topic here, We needed to make a low-poly weapon with the maximum amount of 73triangles (yes triangles, we're working with the Cry(Tek)Engine at school, it reads triangles easier then verticles or what-so-ever that's what they've told us.)
So here is a render : [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/29kqot3.png[/img]
And for the ones who like a wireframe : (also polycount in it) [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/34hdh4z.png[/img]
Sorry for the delay on the big models that I am making at the moment, but I am currently also going through some private madness with my girlfriend, so yeah.
Anyways, tell me what you think.

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Again… I say
“lolwut. subdivision is just making the model higher poly. it should support subdivision, although JIMB is right, it would ruin the point of a low poly model haha. Unless you intended to subdivide in the first place.”

Read full topic
item.source: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class

item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:28, topic:422828”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=525488.msg3828462#msg3828462 date=1322373607]
who brought up subdivision? that would would ruin the purpose of creating a low poly model would it not?
[/quote]I didn’t ment to relate the subdivion part of the support to this model, I just think that it surely lacks some supportive points that Game Artists need to bring up a nice game/model[/quote]lulwut?

Read full topic

item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Assassins Creed Fan:

For the crytek engine doesn’t support subdivisions in 3d objects if I am right

lolwut. subdivision is just making the model higher poly. it should support subdivision, although JIMB is right, it would ruin the point of a low poly model haha. Unless you intended to subdivide in the first place.

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:22, topic:422828”][quote author=Assassins Creed Fan link=topic=525488.msg3826955#msg3826955 date=1322260759]

[quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=525488.msg3826661#msg3826661 date=1322248693]
This is like 2 seconds of modeling… I don’t care if it was supposed to be a low poly model. The handle looks like you randomly loop cut a square and moved the loops around on the X axis. The hatchet head is way too under detailed in comparison to the handle and you didn’t even take the time to combine the edges on the blade of it…
[/quote]Bretty big mouth for just being on a Modelling Board, don’t you think?
I can take feedback, but the way you are telling me what I did wrong, and how I messed up badly, is making me think that you have a lot of anger deep inside of you that you are keeping inside of you. You should go see a psych or something.
Not wanting to start an argue with this, but don’t you think, that if you gave me feedback in a positive way, rather in a normal base of grammar, and not with your herpy derpy angry mode blasting on me like your frikkin’ shoop da whoop or what not, that you would point me on my faults and on how to improve, that it wouldn’t get you more respect from users on MoparScape?
Just to say, I am currently disrespecting you , just by how you comment on my topic.
Just like I said, I can take feedback, but this isn’t feedback at all buddy.
[/quote]Didn’t give you feedback? I’m guessing you didn’t get passed the second sentence before you came and wrote an essay on why I’m a douche bag. Here let me fix it for you so that you’ll take the criticism: I like how you got two squares and loop cut them, and scaled a little, good job, you’re the best low poly modeler ever.

Does the crytek engine support textures? Because a texture would maybe get your point across as to what’s going on with this model.[/quote]Big thanks on the criticism ! , I still feel like to apologize to you, sir.
I’ve had a bad evening that day and for some reason I raged it all over you, my honest apologies for that.
I understand what you’re saying, and will give the model a twist when I get time to do so.
For the crytek engine’s texture support, for that what I know about it it does have texture support, but it doesn’t support subdivisions in 3d objects if I am right

Read full topic
item.source: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class

@ravens wrote:

Assassins Creed Fan:

If you would read what I’ve told you there, you wouldn’t directly ask for my good stuff, I’m not online a lot because of my private situation at the moment, so the only time that I get to work on my models is in school, which is like 12hrs a week ;/ minus the hours spend with class models, that leaves +/- 6hrs

sorry didn’t read some of it. good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Sometimes harsh criticism is the best for those who are trying to learn, you can’t always be like a 4 yearold who drew a stupid picture and expect people to go “That’s the best picture ever! I’m going to put it on the fridge” Toughen up and take it like a man.

Read full topic

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:6, topic:422828”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=525488.msg3826661#msg3826661 date=1322248693]
This is like 2 seconds of modeling… I don’t care if it was supposed to be a low poly model. The handle looks like you randomly loop cut a square and moved the loops around on the X axis. The hatchet head is way too under detailed in comparison to the handle and you didn’t even take the time to combine the edges on the blade of it…
[/quote]Bretty big mouth for just being on a Modelling Board, don’t you think?
I can take feedback, but the way you are telling me what I did wrong, and how I messed up badly, is making me think that you have a lot of anger deep inside of you that you are keeping inside of you. You should go see a psych or something.
Not wanting to start an argue with this, but don’t you think, that if you gave me feedback in a positive way, rather in a normal base of grammar, and not with your herpy derpy angry mode blasting on me like your frikkin’ shoop da whoop or what not, that you would point me on my faults and on how to improve, that it wouldn’t get you more respect from users on MoparScape?
Just to say, I am currently disrespecting you , just by how you comment on my topic.
Just like I said, I can take feedback, but this isn’t feedback at all buddy.[/quote]Didn’t give you feedback? I’m guessing you didn’t get passed the second sentence before you came and wrote an essay on why I’m a douche bag. Here let me fix it for you so that you’ll take the criticism: I like how you got two squares and loop cut them, and scaled a little, good job, you’re the best low poly modeler ever.

Does the crytek engine support textures? Because a texture would maybe get your point across as to what’s going on with this model.

Read full topic
item.source: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:20, topic:422828”]I understand this is rude, but I hate the blade You should’ve made the blade the focus, rather than the handle. Something like this, but obviously with more effort put into it:

It may be a 73 poly maximum, but it shouldn’t have a minimum. That was only 40 faces, 28 coming from the axe head. Make sure that the majority of the faces are where you want people to focus on in your model. The handle for something such as an axe is typically overlooked, so it shouldn’t have as many faces.[/quote]
I agree with rip4d. Maybe 8 more polys in rip4d’s blade and 12 more in the handle and you have a nice axe. Probably could get rid of two of those loop cuts int ACF’s and still have the same effect with the handle.

Read full topic
item.source: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I understand this is rude, but I hate the blade You should’ve made the blade the focus, rather than the handle. Something like this, but obviously with more effort put into it:

It may be a 73 poly maximum, but it shouldn’t have a minimum. That was only 40 faces, 28 coming from the axe head. Make sure that the majority of the faces are where you want people to focus on in your model. The handle for something such as an axe is typically overlooked, so it shouldn’t have as many faces.

Read full topic
item.source: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:18, topic:422828”][quote author=whackatre link=topic=525488.msg3827215#msg3827215 date=1322276278]

[quote author=Assassins Creed Fan link=topic=525488.msg3827214#msg3827214 date=1322276073]

Sorry for asking, but how do you blend the shapes together?
[/quote]What programme are you using?

Meta.
[/quote]Not sure if you can blend shapes together with meta, although iGuess that you could move them towards eachother with your movetool in your Command box (If I got the name right of the box)
I have stopped using Meta, but iGuess that this should work in it ;)[/quote]

It’s absolutely dreadful. I can’t post a picture right now, but I’ll try to explain what it looks like. The lighting is hideous. Even a blind man could see each individual shape. Moving them together (overlapping) doesn’t do a thing.

Read full topic

On-Topic here, We needed to make a low-poly weapon with the maximum amount of 73triangles (yes triangles, we’re working with the Cry(Tek)Engine at school, it reads triangles easier then verticles or what-so-ever that’s what they’ve told us.)

So here is a render :

Sorry for the delay on the big models that I am making at the moment, but I am currently also going through some private madness with my girlfriend, so yeah.

item.title: Low Poly Hatchet For Modelling Class
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:10, topic:422828”][quote author=Assassins Creed Fan link=topic=525488.msg3826955#msg3826955 date=1322260759]
Bretty big mouth for just being on a Modelling Board, don’t you think?
I can take feedback, but the way you are telling me what I did wrong, and how I messed up badly, is making me think that you have a lot of anger deep inside of you that you are keeping inside of you. You should go see a psych or something.
Not wanting to start an argue with this, but don’t you think, that if you gave me feedback in a positive way, rather in a normal base of grammar, and not with your herpy derpy angry mode blasting on me like your frikkin’ shoop da whoop or what not, that you would point me on my faults and on how to improve, that it wouldn’t get you more respect from users on MoparScape?
Just to say, I am currently disrespecting you , just by how you comment on my topic.
Just like I said, I can take feedback, but this isn’t feedback at all buddy.
[/quote]
He’s right though, you could of spared a few loopcuts on the handle and you should of joined those vertices to give it an actual edge on the axe head.[/quote]He could be right, but such an attitude is not needed

Read full topic

The handle looks like you randomly loop cut a square and moved the loops around on the X axis. The hatchet head is way too under detailed in comparison to the handle and you didn’t even take the time to combine the edges on the blade of it…[/quote]Bretty big mouth for just being on a Modelling Board, don’t you think?
